div.bibl: La Parola dei Socialisti, July 13, 1912. THE PRESSMEN'S WALKOUT.

body.p: Hearst, the self-styled friend of labor, is beyond any doubt the worst of businessmen. He advertises throughout the country that printers and apprentices to work at fair wages with provision for board and lodging, are wanted in Chicago. At the same time he keeps his own printers locked out. In order to deceive the Chicago public, he establishes a new union of scab newsboys, which is something impossible.
